tasks.task: Build cold frames under a black walnut tree
subtasks: Clear snow from the ground area
Prepare the ground by letting the sun melt the snow
Cut boards for constructing the cold frames
Ensure a level surface for the cold frames
Assemble the bottom rectangles of the cold frames
Construct the top sections of the cold frames
Fill the cold frames with soil to check stability
Attach tops to the cold frames using 2x2s and Tuftex panels
Install hinges to allow opening and closing of the cold frames
Identify the location for the cold frames (under a black walnut tree)
Consider the benefits of the chosen location (soil enrichment, sun exposure)
Plan for future expansion of the kitchen garden
Attempt to create a trail or path in the snow (sarcastically referred to as "earth shoveling")
Note the difficulty in creating a durable trail in snow
Spread mulch to protect and enrich the soil
Maintain the mulched areas to retain moisture and suppress weeds
